Then the outer door slams open and a blast of air shoots out among the stars. His body lost in the infinite night. Aurora steps into Jim's arms. Lays her head on his chest. a moment he holds her. Then she pushes him gently back. M his eyes sadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim watches her walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur polishes glasses, chipper as ever. A SWEEPER ROBOT passes on its daily errands.

dialogues.speaker: FORWARD OBSERVATION DECK
dialogues.text: Aurora slouches in her writing chair, staring into space picture of sorrow.

dialogues.speaker: SUBDECK C
dialogues.text: Jim sits motionless at his workbench, brooding. A CLATTER rouses him. Jim's little pet robot is banging its head against the wa emitting beeps of distress. Jim frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim walks in.   Everywhere robots bunch and stumble. A pair of sweeper robots fight to enter the same rechargi niche. They trip up a procession of gangly window washers who stumble into a parade of robot waiters. Chaos spreads. The robots' clockwork perfection upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aurora draws a glass of orange juice and gets green sludg Dials for toast and gets two slices of charcoal.

dialogues.speaker: COMMAND DECK
dialogues.text: Aurora enters. The Diagnostic Computer's console is no lo dark: it's a sea of green and red lights. A lot of red. The computer's screen reads "Diagnostic Complete." It displays a long list of error messages. 271   Aurora stares in horror at the red lights. Jim enters behind her. Takes in the bad news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's trouble everywhere. Atmosphere systems, water systems, waste systems, robot control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aurora goes to the worktable: its surface displays the diagnostic report. Thousands of faults and failures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It started two years ago. Thirty years with no trouble, then forty- seven failures in a single day. (reading the list) Structural concussion. System overvoltage. Transient pressure anomaly. Circuit reset, conduit 12. Sync failure, hibernation pod 1498.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pod 1498? That's me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever happened that day woke you up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls up a graph of failures over time: A trickle of breakdowns that swells into a torrent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever since then, more and more failures. Faster and faster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do we find out what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We start at the beginning. The breakdowns from the day I woke up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aurora brings up a map of the ship on the display. Red markers blink on the map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all on Deck One.

dialogues.speaker: DECK FOUR
dialogues.text: An armored hatch leads to the Engine Room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim wears his tool belt. Aurora carries a flashlight. Eac them carries one of Gus's manuals. Jim swipes Gus's crew card and the hatch opens. They go i

dialogues.speaker: ENGINE COMPARTMENT
dialogues.text: A huge space spanning multiple decks at the rear of the s Here the real heart of the Excelsior throbs in the dark. Jim and Aurora emerge into a humming electrical station. peers at gauges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Power Converter seems okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The failures are all below us.

dialogues.speaker: ENGINE COMPARTMENT
dialogues.text: A huge sphere 120 feet across dominates the compartment. Signs read: CAUTION - FUSION REACTOR. A deep RUMBLE. Jim and Aurora descend beside the reactor on a spiral sta They emerge onto a catwalk at the reactor's equator and w around the sphere.

dialogues.speaker: REACTOR CONTROL ROOM
dialogues.text: Jim cards open a door labeled "REACTOR CONTROL ROOM." Red light pours out. They enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banks of control panels - but Jim and Aurora have eyes on for the windows into the reactor's heart. Inside the reactor is a caged sun: an orb of fire hanging space. Loops and tongues of flame leap from its surface. It roars like a forest fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scares the hell out of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What keeps it in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gravity. The gravity plant gives us weight. Propels the ship. And it contains the fusion reaction. All one system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aurora watches Jim as he walks among the consoles, studyi the instruments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much trouble here. A couple of computers running hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cluster of failures is still one level down.

dialogues.speaker: ENGINE COMPARTMENT
dialogues.text: Jim and Aurora emerge from an elevator. They come to a do marked CENTRAL COMPUTING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This should be it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim cards the door with Gus's shipcard. The lock flashes red light and stays closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus's card should open any door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flipping through her manual) Let me try an override code.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She squeezes past Jim. Taps at the door's keypad. Jim pee through the narrow window in the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a sec, maybe there's a reason the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light flashes green. The door begins to slide open. A HOWLING WIND sucks Aurora against the crack in the door She screams. Jim grabs at her. A hurricane drags her insi

dialogues.speaker: CENTRAL COMPUTER FACILITY
dialogues.text: Aurora tumbles into the room and smashes into a column. S clings in the gale-force wind, grimacing in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a RAGGED HOLE punched in the hull. Outside, stars burn in the vacuum of space. A tornado of escaping air screams out through the hole. Red lights flash. Claxons sound. The door begins to close Jim pulls a HAMMER from his belt and jams it crossways in doorway, propping open the door. The door's motors whine. Jim dives inside. Skids to a stop beside Aurora. Pulls he loose from the column and shoves her toward the door, fighting the wind. Aurora scrambles through the doorway. Jim tries to follow but the hammer suddenly bends and springs out of the door The door slams: Aurora outside, Jim in the airless room. The last of the atmosphere flashes away into space. Aurora screams and pounds on the other side of the door. Jim hears only his own thudding heartbeat. The last air leaves Jim's lungs in a silent shout, vapor whipping away between his teeth. He spins. Scans the room desperately.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE DOOR
dialogues.text: Aurora re-enters the override code. But the code is denie She drops to her knees. Scans frantically through her man

dialogues.speaker: IN THE AIRLESS ROOM
dialogues.text: Jim rips open a wide metal drawer built into the wall. It full of computer components: Jim sweeps them onto the flo

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE DOOR
dialogues.text: Aurora tears open an instrument panel beside the door, revealing a yellow emergency button marked "PURGE." She f back the safety catch and slams the button.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE AIRLESS ROOM
dialogues.text: White jets of compressed air blast from the ceiling, turn the room into a whirling tornado of debris. Jim clings for his life, gulping air as flying fragments batter him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wind tears him from his handholds and hurls him towar the jagged hole in the hull. He falls ACROSS THE HOLE. Metal fangs inches from his bod He strains to avoid being speared or sucked out into spac The air jets stop. The wind dies as the air escapes. Jim lunges back to the open drawer. Pulls the LASER CUTTE from his tool belt and cuts the entire drawer free. He turns back, holding the metal DRAWER like a shield - a staggers, half fainting.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE DOOR
dialogues.text: Aurora sees Jim falter. Slams the PURGE button again.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE AIRLESS ROOM
dialogues.text: Compressed air blasts into the room, renewing the windsto Jim rides the wind, sliding across the steel deck and SLAMMING the steel drawer across the hole in the hull. Air screams away through the gaps. Jim lunges to an emergency locker and pulls out an epoxy foamer - a steel canister like a fire extinguisher. He ai it at the hole in the hull and pulls the trigger. ORANGE FOAM blasts out, stiffening into a hard plastic. J buries the steel drawer and the hull breach in foam. His eyes flutter closed. Starved of oxygen, he falls limp

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE DOOR
dialogues.text: Aurora hits the PURGE button. White jets of air blast int the sealed room. The pressure comes up. The door slides o

dialogues.speaker: CENTRAL COMPUTER FACILITY
dialogues.text: Aurora dashes in. Falls to her knees beside Jim. Takes hi pulse. Listens for breath: he's not breathing. She presse her mouth over his and blows air into his lungs. After a moment Jim coughs. He opens bloodshot eyes. She p his head on her knee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim. Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim breathes deeply. Blinks his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'm all right. (his eyes go wide) Look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the center of the room a round column houses the CORE COMPUTER. There's a CRATER blasted in the machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the core computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim hauls himself to his feet, leaning on Aurora. He approaches the blasted computer. Reaches into the hole. Strains. A CREAK...and Jim pulls a melon-sized METEOR fro the crater. An orb of pitted metal.

dialogues.speaker: COMMAND DECK
dialogues.text: Jim and Aurora sit at the worktable. The meteor sits betw them on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A meteor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare at the meteor: the cause of it all. A BEEP: on the Diagnostic Computer's console, more green lights turn red. New errors pop up on the diagnostic repo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get it. This thing hit down on Deck One. But there are failures everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The computers are networked. Ever since the core computer got blown away, all the other computers must have been carrying the load. Running at full capacity around the clock for two years. They're burning out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And every computer that burns out increases the load on the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. The breakdown accelerates. If we don't stop it, the whole ship will go down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trapped on a sinking ship?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus said there's spares for everything. If we replace the core computer, it'll pick up the load. The burnouts will stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another BEEP. Another green light turns red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: SUBDECK A
dialogues.text: Jim pilots his golf cart at breakneck speed through the c racks. Aurora rides shotgun, reading an electronic map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two more rows, then left!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cart squeals around a corner.

dialogues.speaker: CENTRAL COMPUTER FACILITY
dialogues.text: Aurora buries the hull breach in another layer of epoxy f Jim wrestles a massive crate off the golf cart's cargo de Wearily uncrates the replacement computer.

dialogues.speaker: CENTRAL COMPUTER FACILITY
dialogues.text: Aurora inspects the replacement core computer, a manual i her hands. The pages she's consulting are covered with Gu handwritten notes. Jim sits on the floor with another manual. Cables and connectors lie around him on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First you connect the data bus, then the sync cable, then bridge the power and backup power...you're supposed to run a startup checklist, but Gus made a note. He says you can skip straight to power-up as long as you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim is nodding off over his manual. He looks up, blinking

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to sleep. We can't make mistakes here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just got sucked into outer space. Take a break.

dialogues.speaker: ELITE DECK
dialogues.text: Jim lies asleep in trousers and T-shirt, dead to the worl

dialogues.speaker: DECK NINE
dialogues.text: Aurora wakes. Rolls out of bed.

dialogues.speaker: COMMAND DECK
dialogues.text: Aurora sips coffee. Surveys the Diagnostic Computer's war lights. Turns to stare thoughtfully at the meteor itself. She exits. The console flickers. A green light turns red. And anothe The pattern of red lights spreads like a bloodstain.

dialogues.speaker: ELITE DECK
dialogues.text: Jim still lies sleeping. He hasn't moved a muscle. Aurora looks in on him, and slips quietly away.

dialogues.speaker: DECK TWO
dialogues.text: In a bathing suit, Aurora dives into the pool, cleaving t water cleanly and striking out in a crawl stroke. She reaches the end of the lane. Kick-turns and swims bac ...and the gravity cuts out. The water heaves itself into weird humps and tentacles. Aurora flounders in the weightless water.

dialogues.speaker: BERLIN SUITE, (ZERO GRAVITY)
dialogues.text: Sound asleep, Jim floats weightless from his bed, his bla billowing. He touches the ceiling. His eyes open. He shouts in astonishment. Gus' crew card floats in front of him. He grabs it. His blanket snarls around him: he struggles to free himself.

dialogues.speaker: SWIMMING POOL, (ZERO GRAVITY)
dialogues.text: Rippling masses of water float everywhere, dividing and merging. There is no surface. There is no up. In the middle of this chaos, Aurora is trying not to drow A truck-sized blob of water swallows her up. Inside the jiggling mass she struggles, running out of ai She gathers herself. Lunges through the water. Shoots out the blob, gasping for breath. She drifts within reach of a railing and grabs hold.

dialogues.speaker: BERLIN SUITE, (ZERO GRAVITY)
dialogues.text: Jim braces himself in a corner of the ceiling. Spots his belt floating in mid-air. He dives through the air, snags his tool belt on the way, opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aurora!

dialogues.speaker: ELITE DECK
dialogues.text: Jim emerges from a corridor onto the promenade: airborne, propelling himself from one handhold to the next. He's barefoot in trousers and undershirt, his toolbelt ar his waist. Gus's shipcard around his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the middle of the atrium, Aurora drifts mid-air, far f any handhold. She wears a damp shirt over her bathing sui

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm drifting helplessly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to get you down. The gravity might come back on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aurora hadn't thought of that. She looks down fearfully. Jim swings over the railing. Braces his feet. Takes aim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa. Hey. Let's talk about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To what?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim dives at her like Superman. Wraps his arms around her They tumble through space until Jim grabs a railing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no gravity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. That's bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is there no gravity?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gravity plant's failing. Internal field goes first. After that the engines die...then the fusion reactor goes nova.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to get the core computer online. Now.

dialogues.speaker: ENGINE COMPARTMENT
dialogues.text: A roar of THUNDER. The caged sun shudders. Tongues of fir lick from its surface.

dialogues.speaker: DECK FIVE
dialogues.text: Jim and Aurora, getting the hang of it, shoot down a hall dodging a robot that spins its wheels in the air.

dialogues.speaker: ENGINE COMPARTMENT
dialogues.text: Jim and Aurora float into the room and stare: Jim's golf and the replacement Core Computer hang tumbling in the ai Aurora extends her hand to Jim. He takes her hand, and wi his other hand grabs a handhold. Aurora floats up and gra the replacement core computer by a cable. A human chain, haul it down to the deck. Aurora holds the new computer down. Jim floats up to the ruined old computer. Opens latches. Disconnects cables. E the machine out of the column into the air. The room shakes. A deep note in the background falls sile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The engines just shut down.

dialogues.speaker: FUSION REACTOR CONTROL ROOM, (ZERO GRAVITY)
dialogues.text: Consoles alive with warning lights. The room is bathed wi hellish glow: the orb of fire swells and roars. A computer burns out with a sputter of flame. The air fil with a haze of smoke.  FUSION REACTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The caged sun boils and swells. Tentacles of flame graze reactor walls, leaving charred trails.

dialogues.speaker: CORE COMPUTER ROOM, (ZERO GRAVITY)
dialogues.text: Jim and Aurora strain at the replacement computer: it's nearly in place. Each shoves with one hand, gripping a handhold with the other. Their feet kick in the empty air Red lights flash. A warning klaxon sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reactor failure. Reactor failure. Passengers please remain calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aurora holds the computer in place, gripping two handhold her shoulder planted against the machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim floats up, reaches around the computer to connect cab

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does the data cable go in the "bus" port or the "through" port?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bus port! The blue one!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship shudders violently, throwing them from side to s Jim forces one cable after another into their sockets. Aurora tires: the computer slides out of place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it! Hold it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trying!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She strains. The computer slides back into place. Jim closes the last connection. Slips out of the niche an lowers the clamps that hold the computer in place. He throws the heavy power lever. The lights go out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wave of darkness engulfs the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Floating, Jim and Aurora stare at each other in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The core computer flashes to life. The lights come back o So does the gravity. Jim and Aurora slam to the floor. In away, the old computer plunges down and embeds itself in deck. Across the room the golf cart bounces on its tires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The orb of fire withdraws its blazing tentacles and dwind to its proper size.

dialogues.speaker: CORE COMPUTER ROOM
dialogues.text: Jim and Aurora lie on the deck, breathing hard. Aurora st to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's so funny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're alive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The engines rumble back to life. A distant, rhythmic sound begins: BOOM-CHAK...BOOM-CHAK..

dialogues.speaker: DECK TWO
dialogues.text: Jim and Aurora walk wearily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to replace the other burned- out computers. But we have time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aurora slides her arm around his waist. BOOM-CHAK...BOOM-CHAK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that sound?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aurora stiffens, looking over his shoulder. Outside the window, a hibernation pod spins into view. A woman inside

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finding her voice) Jim!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns. Stares in shock as more pods drift past the win  HIBERNATION BAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim and Aurora sprint into the facility. The sound is lou here: BOOM-CHAK...BOOM-CHAK... It's the sound of hibernation pods being ejected. The wav ejections marches down an aisle: one pod after another disappearing into the ceiling. Jim rushes to a CONSOLE. Scans the display.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hibernation system rebooted. It thinks the ship's in port. It's ejecting the empty pods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship leaves a trail of glowing hibernation pods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim slides to a halt in front of a hibernation pod. Pulls power driver from his belt and removes the cover panel. Aurora arrives on his heels. Watches as he works. An ominous sound approaches. BOOM-CHAK...BOOM-CHAK... The wave of ejections advances down their row.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not fast enough. The pod slides up and out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pods Jim was working on tumbles out into space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim slams into the facility at a dead run. Scans the crew hibernation pods. Picks one and goes to work. Aurora enters. Looks at the man inside the hibernation po stern fellow with a bristling gray beard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sounds of the ejection wave come closer. Boom-chak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have much time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM-CHAK! A crewman's pod vanishes into the ceiling on t opposite side. The ejections march down the row.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go go go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wave of ejections reaches the end of the facility and marches back on Jim's side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hibernation pod hums to life. Inside, the Captain opens his eyes. He stares in astonish at the first thing he sees: Aurora, in her bathing suit a shirt, a disheveled angel.

dialogues.speaker: BOOM-CHAK
dialogues.text: The pod beside the Captain's shoots out of sight. He sees Looks at Aurora in alarm. Reaches out, his hand spread fl on the glass. She reaches back, her hand matching his. The Captain's pod rises through the ceiling and vanishes. roars in frustration. Aurora leaps back with a cry of hor

dialogues.speaker: DECK NINE
dialogues.text: Jim and Aurora stare out the windows. In the ship's wake, five thousand pods glitter like diamonds. The cloud of po dispersing as they watch. Stricken, Aurora walks away. Jim watches her go, then turns back to the window, lookin out at the tumbling sparks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The starship recedes, leaving five thousand pods in its w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim stands at the Diagnostic Computer. The indicator ligh panel is a sea of green. Only a few red lights remain. Aurora enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the last of the burned out processors. When it reboots we should be all green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we talk?

dialogues.speaker: FORWARD OBSERVATION DECK
dialogues.text: Aurora's writing couch. Jim and Aurora sit facing each ot Aurora gathers her thoughts. Takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, if it wasn't for you waking me up, I'd be drifting out in space right now with the others. And if you'd never awakened, the whole ship would have been lost while we slept.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim shakes his head at the tangle of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But no matter how we got here, the fact is that we're here. All I know is, when I have a good idea, you're the person I want to tell. When I wake up in the morning, I wish you were there. When I look at you, I just see Jim. And I miss him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim looks at her, moved and caught off-guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've missed you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to be angry anymore. I can't be. We've come through too much. No matter what you've done... the fact is, I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim reaches out and takes her hand. She watches him intertwine his fingers with hers. Aurora gazes out at the stars - the endless shining sky t enfolds them. She looks at Jim and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell of a life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim meets her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell of a life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She climbs into his lap, and they kiss. A kiss with a yea frustration behind it. A kiss that matters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The airlock opens with a gust of air. Jim emerges in a sp suit - followed by Aurora.

dialogues.speaker: ATOP THE SHIP
dialogues.text: They walk toward the bow, stars reflected in their visors

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BOW
dialogues.text: They sit side by side. Aurora takes Jim's hand. They lean together, helmets touching, and look together i the blue stars of their future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An orange sun rises over green hills. In the foreground t roofs of Homestead II's capital city glow in the dawn. At the city's edge, timeworn spacecraft sit on their land gear around a grassy landing field. Colonists gather. They watch the sky expectantly... A new star shines on the horizon. The star grows into a white starship gleaming in the sun. Excelsior sweeps over the field with a rumble of engines. The ship's hull is scorched and abraded from its cosmic crossing. But the lights shine, the engines throb, the landing gear receive the weight of the ship. The starship's gangway lowers. The doors open. CHILDREN run down the gangway. Children of all ages, of a races. Twenty of them, thirty. They point at the sun, at clouds, laughing, wide-eyed in wonder. We move up the gangway, through the disembarking passenge Behind the children: Teenagers. Adults in smaller numbers they grow older. Finally a handful of gray-haired elders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transformed by the wear and tear of a century's habitatio Paths worn into floors, furniture repaired or re-purposed We move past vegetable gardens. Battered sweeper robots w the plantings. Window-washers till the soil. The OAK TREE towers a hundred feet tall over the Concours Its branches brush the skylight far above. We move past walls decorated with murals and carvings. At the Concourse Bar, Arthur is slicing vegetables. His timeworn uniform mended by hand. At the aft end of the Concourse, a high wall. Here a long list of dates is inscribed. The last date is the ship's landfall on Homestead II; the first, Jim's awakening. In between: an accelerating tally of births, deaths, marriag catastrophes and achievements...a century of shipboard li At the base of the wall we find a table like an altar, wh a collection of artifacts is displayed: The meteor pried from the Excelsior's heart. Gus's worn shipcard, his picture still visible. A beautiful hand-bound book. In the Blink of an Eye: Our Lives Between the Stars, by Aurora Dunn. Beneath these printed words, a handwritten dedication: For Jim. In the center of it all, in the place of honor: the photo strip of Jim and Aurora from their first date. They laugh. They clown. She kisses him. Aurora looks into the camera's eye. Jim looks at Aurora.
